thread.title: Bayern Munich want Manchester United target Nelson Semedo and more transfer rumours
thread.title_full: Bayern Munich want Manchester United target Nelson Semedo and more transfer rumours

author: Alex Porter
title: Bayern Munich want Manchester United target Nelson Semedo and more transfer rumours
text:
Bayern Munich want Manchester United target Nelson Semedo and more transfer rumours Man Utd have been repeatedly linked with Benfica defender Nelson Semedo. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United could be set to lose out on Benfica defender Nelson Semedo , according to latest reports. 
Semedo was repeatedly linked with United in the January transfer window, but Portuguese outlet O Jogo claims Bayern Munich are now set to swoop. 
Philipp Lahm has announced his intention to retire in the summer, leaving the Bundesliga Champions searching for a replacement for their captain. 
Back-up right-back Rafinha is also entering the final year of his contract with Bayern. 
And that could spark a summer transfer battle for Semedo, who has been valued at around £35m. 
Real Madrid's interest in David De Gea has reportedly been resurrected, with the Spanish side able to sign players again this summer following a transfer ban. Read More Manchester United transfer plans revealed by Ed Woodward 
De Gea has addressed speculation , which has so far centred on a move back to the Spanish capital for the United No.1. 
But The Sun reports Juventus could enter the race for his signature - should they fail to sign AC Milan stopper Gianluigi Donnarumma. 
Juve keeper Gianluigi Buffon is a legend of the game, but the Serie A giants are looking for his long-term replacement, and reportedly see De Gea as a plan B should their domestic rivals prove determined to hold on to their teenage star. 
Keita Balde is reportedly the subject of interest from United and AC Milan - and the Lazio fans don’t like it. 
According to Gazetta Dello Sport , the fans have 'turned on him' and painted a message on the wall of the club’s training ground telling him to concentrate on his own club. 
He is currently stalling on signing a new deal at Lazio, and the Italian press believes he will be on his way in the summer. Read More
